summary: This is an email chain from March 2024 discussing a letter sent to Judge Rakoff regarding Leon Black. The correspondence involves attorneys Jeanne M. Christensen and Douglas Wigdor, and references confidential information in an exhibit.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: She is the sender of an email forwarding a letter sent to Judge Rakoff regarding Leon Black, and cautions about confidential information in an exhibit.

persons.name: Douglas Wigdor
persons.context: Mentioned as having relayed information about a conversation and is associated with the law firm Wigdor LLP.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: The subject of the email chain and the referenced letter sent to Judge Rakoff.

persons.name: Judge Rakoff
persons.context: The recipient of a letter discussed in the email chain, which pertains to Leon Black.

connections.description: They are both attorneys at Wigdor LLP, with Wigdor relaying a conversation to Christensen.
Christensen is involved in legal correspondence (a letter to a judge) concerning Leon Black.
Wigdor is involved in a conversation and legal matter pertaining to Leon Black.

events.title: Letter sent to Judge Rakoff
events.description: A letter was sent to Judge Rakoff regarding Leon Black, containing confidential information in Exhibit C.

events.title: Email forwarding the letter
events.description: Jeanne M. Christensen forwarded the letter sent to Judge Rakoff to another recipient, with a confidentiality warning.

locations.context: Office address of Jeanne M. Christensen, partner at Wigdor LLP.

keyFacts: A letter concerning Leon Black was sent to Judge Rakoff on Friday, March 1, 2024.
Exhibit C of the letter contains highly confidential information, as noted by attorney Jeanne M. Christensen.
The email chain shows communication between attorneys at Wigdor LLP regarding this legal matter in March 2024.
The correspondence is marked as potentially containing confidential or attorney-client privileged information.
